Title: Adieu Dan Agbese
Summary: A luminous star of Nigerian journalism has journeyed beyond the horizon, Yet his brilliance refuses to fade .   Dan Agbese—measured, thoughtful, resolute— You lived with purpose, wrote with courage, And guarded truth as though it were a sacred trust .

Title: Tinubu to assent police pension board bill, personnel may earn 85% of emoluments — Rep
Summary: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu is expected to soon assent to a landmark bill establishing the Nigeria Police Force Pension Board . It will administer police pensions and remove police personnel from the Contributory Pension Scheme (CPS) under the Pension Reform Act .

Title: We’ll not allow Fayose to destroy PDP in Ekiti – Oluyede
Summary: Wole Oluyede said the party won't allow Fayose to destroy the structure being built by the leaders to ensure PDP wins the 2026 governorship election in Ekiti . Fayose is a former governor of the state, and is currently the current governor of Ekiti state .

Title: Ijebu-Ode to host inaugural Detty December event
Summary: Ijebu-Ode, Ogun State, is set to join Nigeria’s Detty December circuit . Organisers announce plans for the maiden edition of the maiden version of the IJebu Shutdown Party . The event aims to positioning the city as a prime destination for premium entertainment and youth tourism .

Title: Boko Haram leader jailed 20 years
Summary: Hussaini Isma’il is one of the leaders of the terrorist group, Boko Haram . Justice Emeka Nwite, in a judgment, convicted him in the four counts preferred against him .

Title: COP30 dragged into clash over gender language
Summary: Six governments moved to attach their own interpretations as footnotes to a key text . The row risks complicating the outcome of COP30 climate talks in Brazil .

Title: Insecurity: It’s time to make tough calls, Rotimi Amaechi tells Tinubu
Summary: Chibuike Rotimi Amaechi has urged President Bola Ahmed Tinubu to take decisive action against rising insecurity across Nigeria . He said the government’s failure to act decisively has emboldened terrorists and eroded public trust .

Title: ‘Bad boys have taken over Ekiti’ — Bejide slams APC, plots 2026 upset
Summary: The African Democratic Congress (ADC) candidate in Ekiti State, Amb. Patrick Bejide, said the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) had lost its grip on the state .

Title: FG to Resident Doctors: Suspend your strike, 19 of 20 demands already addressed
Summary: Federal Government has enjoined Nigerian Association of Resident Doctors, NARD, to suspend its ongoing industrial action . Minister of Labour and Employment Dr. Mohammad Maigari Dingyadi made the plea in Abuja, during a conciliation meeting .

Title: 45 million Nigerians practise open defecation — Minister
Summary: The Minister of Environment, Balarabe Lawal, said over 45 million Nigerians still practice open defecation . He said only about 25 per cent of the population have access to safely managed sanitation facilities . Lawal said this in Abuja at a press briefing to commemorate the 2025 World Toilet Day .
